business.headline: Oracle cuts over 100 jobs in India as AI reshapes workforceOracle, which employs around 30,000 people in India, reported a revenue of Rs 20,459 crore in the year ended March 2024, a 20% jump from the previous year.

Backpacking on a budget: Smart forex tips for young travellersFor young backpackers, every rupee counts. While cheap flights and hostels often top the checklist, the way you manage foreign exchange could quietly decide whether your trip stays on budget, or slips into overspending.

Hyderabad on track to become a global tech hub: D Sridhar BabuHyderabad is aiming to become a global technology hub, focusing on innovation, start-ups, and talent development. Selling property? Here are 9 smart ways to save on capital gains taxSelling property can bring you a good profit, but it often comes with the worry of paying a hefty capital gains tax. Luckily, the Income Tax Act offers several ways to cut down or even avoid this tax if you plan wisely.

entertainment.headline: Shwetha Menon on obscenity case: Was shattered, then I became a fiery tigressAt the India Today Conclave South 2025, actor Shwetha Menon reacted to the FIR filed against her while she was contesting for the president of Association of Malayalam Movie Actors (AMMA).

She said she is being offered films because of her talent and not what happened in her personal life. Dhanashree and cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal got divorced in March 2025.

The foundation has sent five boats to flood-affected areas. It has also planned to adopt flood-hit border villages near Husainiwala.

Is Rise & Fall what Bigg Boss once used to be?'Rise & Fall' debuts as a fresh reality show focusing on power and social divides. Here's a look at how this show will remind you what 'Bigg Boss' used to be.

Ali Fazal attends Rule Breakers screening at UK Parliament with MP Alice McDonaldActor Ali Fazal attended the screening of 'Rule Breakers'' at UK Parliament. He was joined by MP Alice McDonald.

Tanishaa Mukerji says outsiders lack loyalty, opens up on Uday Chopra, Armaan KohliActor Tanishaa Mukerji opened up about her breakups with Uday Chopra and Armaan Kohli, while also calling Bollywood outsiders "not loyal" to the industry.

Hina slams Farrhana for belittling Ashnoor's TV career, calls her a wannabeActor Hina Khan criticised Farrhana Bhatt for commenting about Ashnoor Kaur's television background on 'Bigg Boss 19'. She later deleted the post.

Allu Arjun receives show-cause notice from corporation over illegal constructionActor Allu Arjun has been served a show-cause notice by Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) for unauthorised construction at his Jubilee Hills property. The notice threatens demolition of the illegal extension, raising concerns about compliance and legal action.

general news.headline: Nepal PM KP Sharma Oli resigns amid deadly Gen Z protests, Army appeals for peaceProtests continued in Nepal for the second day despite the government announcing that it had lifted the ban on social media platforms. The second day of demonstrations left two more people dead, pushing the death toll to 22.

Live: Play constructive role in maintaining peace, Nepal Army appeals to Gen ZKP Sharma Oli resigned as Nepal's Prime Minister on Tuesday following violent protests triggered by a ban on major social media platforms and anger over corruption. At least 22 people were killed and hundreds injured as police used deadly force against demonstrators, mostly youths leading what came to be called the "Gen Z" movement. Despite the government rolling back the ban, protests intensified on the second day, with crowds attacking and injuring Nepalese leaders. India Today is reporting live from ground zero in Nepal. Pankaj Das, Amit Bharadwaj and Rohit Singh are present at the scene. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Numbers back NDA in vice-presidential election battle, result likely by 8 pmThe election comes fifty days after Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned from the post on July 21, citing health reasons. The vacancy triggered a fresh contest for the nation's second-highest constitutional office, and with it, a political test of strength between the ruling NDA and the opposition INDIA bloc.
3 soldiers killed as avalanche hits Siachen camp, Army captain rescuedAvalanches are common at Siachen Glacier, located on the northern tip of the Line of Control at a height of around 20,000 feet.

When GenZ gets out of their cyber-dwelling and on to the real streets...fireworks!What began as young people curating songs for Instagram Reels turned into a fight for their digital homes when Nepal's government banned social media. The blackout broke the trance, sparking protests that soon targeted corruption. With 19 dead and the Prime Minister gone, the unrest has laid bare how fragile regimes can be.

Fungus on hands, smelly clothes, can't live in jail: Darshan asks judge for poisonActor Darshan, accused in the Renukaswamy murder case in Karnataka, pleaded with the judge to give him poison, citing unbearable jail conditions. The judge refused his request.

With Nepal, India's neighbourhood in turmoil again. US vs China playing out?Nepal protests: What started as an agitation in Nepal against a social media ban, quickly spiralled into protests against corruption, forcing Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli to resign. It follows a familiar script that happened in Bangladesh and Sri Lanka.

Live: Veep election voting ends, NDA sets table for celebration dinnerVice President Election 2025 Voting Live Updates: India will have a new Vice President by Tuesday night, with members of Parliament voting to fill the post left vacant after Jagdeep Dhankhar's abrupt resignation. The contest has pitted the BJP-led ruling NDA's nominee, Maharashtra Governor CP Radhakrishnan, against the opposition INDIA bloc's choice, former Supreme Court judge B Sudershan Reddy. Polling began at 10 am in the new Parliament building, with members of both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha eligible to cast their votes until 5 pm. Counting of ballots will start at 6 pm, and the results are expected later in the evening. Although the BJP-led alliance has a numerical advantage, the outcome could hinge on cross-voting since MPs are not bound by a party whip and ballots are cast in secrecy. Stay with IndiaToday.in for live updates

How Nepal is following Bangladesh script, line for line | 5 pointsNepal Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli resigned on Tuesday after protests by youngsters over social media ban turned into an anti-regime agitation. Nepal's Gen Z protests have uncanny similarities to the Bangladesh agitation from July-August 2024 that toppled the regime of PM Sheikh Hasina. Here's a 5-point explainer.

Oli, India and the curious timing of Nepal protestsThe massive protests in Nepal in which 20 people have been killed came ahead of PM KP Sharma Oli's planned trip to India and after his return from China. India's immediate neighbourhood has become a playground of diverse external forces. Though the Gen Z protests seem to be spontaneous, they come amid China-US tug-of-war and can be hijacked, warn experts.

Why MPs need training for Vice-Presidential election? It's complicatedThe Vice-President election is scheduled for September 9, and MPs from both the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha are undergoing training to understand the complex voting process. Here's a closer look at how both Presidential and Vice Presidential elections are conducted and why MPs need training.

Indian couple assaulted by Chinese man during Switzerland holiday, shares post, picsAn Indian-origin couple alleged that they were brutally assaulted by a Chinese hotel manager during their holiday in Switzerland.

Noida woman's 'I choose to leave India' post sparks debate on reservation policiesA Noida-based woman shared that she is leaving India to pursue an MBA abroad after failing to secure admission to the institutes she considered the "best" in the country, blaming reservation policies for it. Her LinkedIn post has now sparked a debate on the issue. Read on:

Video: Nepal Finance Minister chased on street, kicked, thrashed by protestersNepal's Finance Minister Bishnu Prasad Paudel was attacked by protesters during intense Gen Z protests. The violent clashes erupted as thousands of young protesters confronted security forces in Kathmandu and several other cities across the country. Despite the government lifting the ban on social media platforms, protests in Nepal persisted into their second day. Nepal Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli resigned on Tuesday. In his resignation letter, Oli said he was stepping down "to facilitate a solution to the problem and to help resolve it politically." The first day of Gen Z protests left 20 people dead and more than 250 injured.

Canada rejects 80% Indian student visas in 2025, top choice status fallsCanada, once a top destination for study-abroad aspirants, rejected 80% of visa applications for Indian students in 2025, the highest in a decade. Barely 9% of Indian study abroad aspirants now see it as the top choice. With growing uncertainty and mounting challenges, what does studying in Canada look like now, and what new study-abroad dreams are Indian students embracing?

Video: Nepal Parliament, ministers' houses set ablaze; ruckus on roads amid protestsProtests in Nepal entered their second day despite the government reversing its social media ban. Demonstrators demanded Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli's ouster after two more deaths pushed the toll to 22 and over 300 injured. On Tuesday, Oli resigned, confirming his decision in a letter, as unrest over the crackdown intensified.

PM surveys damage in flood-hit Himachal, Punjab; announces Rs 3,100 crore packagePM Modi announced a financial assistance package of Rs 1,500 crore for flood and landslide-hit Himachal Pradesh and said the Centre would ensure full support in rebuilding and restoration.

Watch: India Today reports from epicentre of Nepal's massive Gen Z uprisingKathmandu is seething. For the second day in a row, Nepal's youth-led uprising raged on, defying curbs on public gatherings and a heavy security clampdown. The turmoil culminated on Tuesday with Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli's resignation, hours after hundreds of demonstrators stormed his office shouting anti-government slogans.

"This protest is not only about the social media ban, but about the corruption happening under Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli's government. We are forced to take the route of violence to show dissent. Children were killed yesterday. They could have handled it peacefully, but instead they shot us," a protester told India Today TV. 

On Monday, violence reached a flashpoint. At least 20 people were killed and more than 300 injured in the violent clashes. Four more were reported injured on Tuesday. The agitators torched Prime Minister Oli's residence in Balkot. They also attacked the house of former home minister Ramesh Lekhak, who resigned a day earlier.

Ahead of iPhone 17 launch, full design leaked. Here's how the phones will lookApple is set to announce the iPhone 17 series tonight at 10:30PM IST, and hours before the official unveiling, leaks and dummy models have already painted a clear picture of what the upcoming lineup will look like.

Why Nepal is the world champion of instability | The LowdownNepal faces fresh political collapse as fragile coalitions crumble. Violent youth-led protests, corruption scandals, and a social media ban fuel nationwide unrest, deepening instability and stalling economic growth and reforms.

The 1963 Hazratbal Crisis: Turning Point in Kashmir's Political and Religious TurmoilIn 1963, the disappearance of a sacred relic from Hazratbal Shrine triggered mass unrest, political conspiracies, and enduring debates, marking a pivotal moment in Kashmir's religious and political history.

India asks citizens to avoid Nepal travel, those there to avoid stepping outIndia has advised its citizens in Nepal to avoid travel and shared helpline numbers for those stranded in the Himalayan nation after violent Gen Z protests left at least 22 dead and prompted curfews in several cities.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna.
